metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0247 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in openfs.c in the libext2fs library ine2fsprogs before 1.42.12 allows local users to execute arbitrary code viacrafted block group descriptor data in a filesystem image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0247` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

e2fsck-static - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.2
e2fslibs - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.2
e2fsprogs - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.2
libcomerr2 - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.2
libss2 - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: e2fsprogs package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.42.9-3ubuntu1.2').
